item.title: Welcome
item.description: About Me I’m Brendan Knapp, a graduate student and analyst specializing in WMD, terrorism, and other security issues who discovered a passion for analytics and coding. In the past, I worked as a combat medic, Arabic linguist, and analyst with a reputation for herding cats and accomplishing tasks way beyond those expected. I’m currently finishing up a Master’s degree in Nonproliferation and Terrorism Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies (MIIS).
